page.title: 12LUTWYCHE HALL, SHROPSHIRE
page.content: Lutwyche Hall,built in the 16th century,is now in the process of being lovingly restored to much nearer its former glory than has been its luck for many a year. Roofs have been renewed or repaired,floorboards lifted and underlying timbers renewed if necessary and everything duly treated. Plumbing and electricity have been attended to,and a flat made for a caretaker and wife,who have been in residence this year. Some of the special trees such as cedars and a very old lime have been pruned and undergrowth cleared - yew bushes trimmed back into shape - and generally a good start to the outward appearance of the grounds. Work in the house is to continue and the owner hopes that 1986 will see the happy outcome of its completion,ready to be lived in again.
